post_text: July 2, 2018 at 4:20 AM#1Hi, can anyone help me with a macro to store the next free whole number cue? I tried several command line syntax entries but could not find one that worked?For example a cue stack has cues 1,2 and 5 stored. If I am in cue 2 the macro would store cue 3.Also looking to make a macro that stores the next .1 cue from my current cue.for example if I am in cue 2.2 it would store cue 2.3.Any help would be appreciated.Thanks.

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: July 4, 2018 at 11:26 AM#2HiUse $selectedexeccue which is the current cue on selected exec.[color=#66FF00]Setvar $NextCue = $selectedexeccue; addvar $NextCue = 1Store cue $nexcue /nc[/color]But that  doesn't work for decimal number (1.2, 2.3 etc) as [color=#FF9933]setvar $var = 1.1; addvar $var = 0.1 >> $var = 1.200000 (number to long).[/color]You can use LUA to remove 0000 :[color=#99FF00]LUA"gma.show.setvar('NextCue',gma.show.getvar('selectedexeccue')+0.1)"Store cue $nextcue /nc[/color]

posts.post_text: July 5, 2018 at 11:07 AM#4HiYou have to insert a wait time of 0.1s or more on line 1. Sorry, i've forget it.To have choice of your extension : +1, +2, +0.1, + 0.2 or other, use that :[color=#99FF00]SetVar $ext (extension ?)[/color]     [color=#FFFF00]//wait 0.1[/color][color=#99FF00]LUA "gma.show.setvar('nextcue',gma.show.getvar('selectedexeccue')+gma.show.getvar('ext'))"[/color]   ///[color=#FFFF00]wait 0.1[/color][color=#99FF00]store cue $nextcue[/color]
